0.Pros: Pretty good experience for those (mainly teens) who have never experienced a real job and want to have a taste of what work is like. Also a good starting resume builder for teens and young adults.
0.Cons: Hours can be pretty bad and work can be hectic.

1.Pros: Great people, Free food and drinks which to a guy in he's late teens was highly worth it.
1.Cons: The politics and low pay for managers and crew alike leads to high turnover rates.

2.Pros: Everyone is super nice and exciting
2.Cons: Teenage drama can be an issue

3.Pros: Fast paced, no time to stand around and be bored.
3.Cons: Customers will almost always be rude, you're almost always understaffed, and its always your fault the food doesn't come out fast enough.

4.Cons: Never do anything right, hate everyone

5.Pros: They have flexabil. Scheduling. You get great training and benefits.if you work full time you get a free meal for your launch.
5.Cons: They pay isn't all that great. If you want to smell like grease and fried food this is the job for you

6.Pros: Pretty good starting job for most people. Show up, do what you're told and you will make it.
6.Cons: Pay is pretty terrible, and management can be a little overbearing sometimes

7.Cons: Starting rate is too low (7.25/hr). High turnover of employees.

8.Pros: The only good thing is that you get to meet people. Your co workers become your family. Which is good sometimes.
8.Cons: A lot of them. Bad pay. Some customers don't make it easy for you. They get mad when prices go up and they blame you as if you owned the store.

9.Pros: Flexible hours, Free Food on Lunch Break
9.Cons: Stressful management, annoying customers, exhausting workload, no raise
